subject: Philosophy
title: Slippery Slope
description: A tiny lesson with a big payoff: Slippery Slope.

hook.text: If we allow this, next thing you know we'll be allowing that! The slippery slope slides on assumptions.

buildup.text: The slippery slope argues that one small step will inevitably lead to extreme consequences.

discovery.text: It assumes a chain of events without proving each link. Each step is presented as automatic.

twist.text: Sometimes slopes are real â€” some policies do have cascading effects. The fallacy is assuming inevitability.

climax.text: The cure: demand evidence for each step in the chain. If any link is weak, the slope isn't slippery.

punchline.text: One step doesn't guarantee a fall. Check the footing.

quiz.question: What makes a slippery slope argument fallacious?
options: Assuming one event will inevitably lead to extreme outcomes without proof
Describing a real chain of events
